deckOfCards

Class NumberCard

  • java.lang.Object
    • deckOfCards.Card
      • deckOfCards.NumberCard

  • public class NumberCard
extends Card
    NumberCard is for Cards 2-10 in a deck.
    Author:
    RossWeinstein

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NumberCard(java.lang.String suit, int value)
      Constructs a NumberCard with a value of 2-10.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int validCardValue(int value)
      Checks that the value of each instance of this class is between 2 and 10

      • Methods inherited from class deckOfCards.Card

        getCardFace, getCardValue, getSuit, setCardFace, setSuit, toString

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • NumberCard

        public NumberCard(java.lang.String suit,
                  int value)
        Constructs a NumberCard with a value of 2-10. Will throw an IllegalArgumentException if any value but 2-10 is given for its value and if any suit is given other than "Hearts", "Diamonds", "Spades", or "Clubs"
        Parameters:
        suit - The suit of the given card: Hearts, Diamonds, Spades, or Clubs
        value - The value of the card, same as the face when it's a NumberCard

    • Method Detail

      • validCardValue

        public int validCardValue(int value)
        Checks that the value of each instance of this class is between 2 and 10
        Parameters:
        value - The value to check; must be between 2 and 10
        Returns:
        int Returns an int if value is between 2 and 10
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - is thrown is values is not between 2 and 10
